results.title: The Wonderful gift of the crane
results.creator_credit: Kazuhiko Watanabe, Masaji Hara, Gakken Company and Nippon Kangyo Bank
results.brief_description: A traditional Japanese story told with animated puppets. An elderly peasant cottage weaver frees a crane from a trap and his kindness is rewarded unexpectedly by magical gifts. The tale unfolds against a backdrop of colourful snow.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kazuhiko Watanabe, Masaji Hara, Gakken Company and Nippon Kangyo Bank

results.title: The Wizard of No
results.creator_credit: J. Gary Mitchell, Jon Olinghouse and J Gary Mitchell Film Company
results.brief_description: Thirteen-year-old Billy is not the most popular boy in class. The Wizard of No suggests that his lack of popularity is directly related to his inability to say “no”. Points out that the word “no” has both a positive and a negative sense. Follows on with advertising and drug education segments.

results.title: The Witch who was afraid of witches
results.creator_credit: Eliot Noyes, Robert McDonald and Noyes Productions
results.brief_description: The youngest witch in her family, Wendy has the weakest witch power. She can hardly take off on her broomstick. She can’t say spells in a scary voice. She can’t even cackle. Worst of all, she is afraid of witches - older, bossy, mean witches like her two older sisters. Always feeling left out, afraid of the dark, afraid of witches, Wendy goes to bed at night hugging her broomstick, which at least gives her a little witch power…until the day before Halloween, when she loses it! Now she has no witch power at all. Left alone on Halloween night, Wendy meets a friend and magically discovers special powers that she has always desired. At first, she uses the spells to seek revenge, but soon she realises her folly, takes off the spells, and earns the sought-after respect and love of her sisters. Based on book by Alice Low. Narrated by Kathryn Walker. Voices by Denise Lute, Diane Salinger, Eliot Noyes.

results.title: The Winning breed
results.brief_description: The film looks at the breeding of thoroughbred racehorses. Important factors in breeding are discussed and the film surveys some of the activities and a variety of horses which are found in several Australian stud farms owned by Wright Stevensons.
results.description: The film looks at the breeding of thoroughbred racehorses. Important factors in breeding are discussed and the film surveys some of the activities and a variety of horses which are found in several Australian stud farms owned by Wright Stevensons.

results.title: The Winged scourge
results.brief_description: Points out that the Anopheles mosquito alone transmits malaria and shows its development from the larva to full growth when it becomes a menace. Various means of combating the mosquito are demonstrated.
results.description: Points out that the Anopheles mosquito alone transmits malaria and shows its development from the larva to full growth when it becomes a menace. Various means of combating the mosquito are demonstrated.

results.title: The Winds of Fogo
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Fogo is a windswept island off the coast of Newfoundland where the inhabitants have lived by, on and from the sea. A fisherman and his sons take a day off from the nets for a journey to the gannet colony on the Funk Islands, fifty miles farther out to sea. There are exceptional close-up views of enormous flocks of seabirds swarming the cliffs and the sky.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Low, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB

results.title: The Wind on the Heath
results.creator_credit: Leon Bijon, Peter Jessop and Cecil Musk
results.brief_description: Explores places of scenic beauty and historic interest amid the mountains and valleys of Britain’s ten National Parks. Against the background of river, mountain and mooorland landscape of river, mountain and moorland landscape, some of the pastimes available to all in the Parks are shown, including climbing in Snowdonia, skiing, and boating on the lakes, and hiking or pony trekking on the moors.

results.title: The Wind in the willows (K)
results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove, Mark Hall and Cosgrove-Hall Productions
results.brief_description: An enchanting puppet musical that captures the beauty of the English countryside and a way of life that disappeared with the decline of the British Empire. The film features favourite characters; Rat, Mole, Badger and Toad of Toad Hall. Based on the story by Kenneth Grahame and adapted by Rosemary Anne Sisson.

results.title: The Wind in the willows
results.creator_credit: Dave Unwin, John Coates, Carlton UK, HIT Entertainment Pictures and TVC London
results.brief_description: Narrated by Vanessa Redgrave, this is an animated adaptation of Kenneth Grahame’s children’s classic “The Wind in the willows.” The adventures of Mole, Rat, Badger and Toad have delighted children for generations. Animated by the team who created “The World of Peter Rabbit and friends”, this production features the voices of Rik Mayall as Toad, Michael Palin as Rat, Alan Bennett as Mole and Michael Gambon as Badger.

results.title: The Wind from the West
results.brief_description: In northern Sweden, the exotic, nomadic Lapps, depend on reindeer herds for their livelihood. Each Spring, the Lapps seek the high uplands for reindeer feed but the very young and aged remain in the valleys. A young Nils watches the procession departing. He dozes and the Wind from the West speaks to him. He dreams that he is in the mountains with his sister, catching Brook trout, cutting willow-roots for basket-making, eating fire baked damper cakes and playing with his dog. The Wind from the West leads him to the highest mountain crag, where the Golden Eagle nests. In Lapp tradition, it is an ancient bravery test to climb to the eagle’s nest and take the bone of the white reindeer calf. For he who makes the climb, the echo, at the peak where the Lapps once made religious sacrifices, tells the size of his reindeer herd. Photography by Arne Sucksdorff. English commentary by Forrest Izard.
